meanings.definition: Ready for immediate use or action
meanings.sent1: The standby flashlight was always charged and ready.
meanings.sent2: The backup generator was on standby in case of a power outage.
meanings.sent3: The standby superhero was always prepared to save the day.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was like a standby anchor in the storm of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The standby paramedic rushed to the scene with swift efficiency.

meanings.definition: A person or thing ready to serve or be used as a substitute
meanings.sent1: The standby teacher filled in when the regular teacher was sick.
meanings.sent2: The standby actor was called in to replace the lead in the play.
meanings.sent3: The standby cake was brought out when the main cake collapsed.
meanings.sent4: She was the standby driver in case the primary driver got lost.
meanings.sent5: The standby goalie was ready to step in at a moment's notice.

meanings.definition: A state of readiness or availability
meanings.sent1: The airplane was on standby for any last-minute passengers.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a standby list of doctors for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The standby mode on the computer saved energy when not in use.
meanings.sent4: His mind was on standby until he heard the alarm go off.
meanings.sent5: The standby crew was prepared for any unexpected changes.
